result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert N. Curtis

records.addlTxt:
1:41 PM Defendant Robert N. Curtis appeared by video, in custody from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Robert N. Curtis.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz received an offer recently but he hasn't been able to meet with the defendant on that yet.  Atty Gumz asks for another status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
*No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1

10:05 AM Defendant Robert N. Curtis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Robert N. Curtis.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim. Defendant does not want to waive the time limits.  

Atty Burdon asks for a $500 Cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz asks for a breakout room.

Court puts parties into a breakout room.

10:14am  BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant waives the time limits for the Prelim.  Court notes that the defendant is on a hold right now.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:10 AM Defendant Robert N. Curtis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Robert N. Curtis.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz asks that this be reset to next week because he was just appointed.  Defendant did receive the complaint.  Atty Juech has no objection due to the defendant being on a hold.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
